title.narrative: PROTECTION OF CHILDREN IN MOVEMENT

description.narrative: By 2022, Dominican institutions will have the capacity to protect children and adolescents in a situation of transit and migration between Haiti and the Dominican Republic., which contributes to Access To Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most vulnerable children and adolescents will be able to exercise their rights to an identity, to live in a family and to be protected against violence.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, Dominican institutions will have the capacity to protect children and adolescents in a situation of transit and migrationbetween Haiti and the Dominican Republic.

description.narrative: UNICEF assisted 3,098 children on the move and prevented 536 illegal expulsions from the Dominican Republic to Haiti. Additionally, UNICEF advocated for better assistance to children in the context of migration or mobility by child protection authorities. Due to the crisis in Haiti, the Government imposed harsher conditions to admit the entrance of pregnant women and increased the number of deportations, targeting pregnant women in a systematic manner, resulting in the number of children assisted by UNICEF has more than doubling. The UN system issued a public statement calling for respect of human rights, especially for women and children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2022
